## **Workshop modules**
Please use the links below to access materials (code, video, feeds) from R workshops. For new users, it is best to start with the introduction to R programming and then move on to more advanced topics. Note that not all workshops are available yet.

<h3 id = "multi"><b>Available workshop content</b></h3>
<a href="./intro-home.html">Introduction to R and RStudio</a>: an introductory stroll through key concepts and syntax in R. This session will cover the basics needed in others listed below.</br>


<h3 id = "multi"><b>Coming soon</b></h3>
<!-- <a href="./fishStats.html"><b>Introduction to fisheries statistics in R</b></a>: -->
<b>Introduction to fisheries statistics in R</b>: an introduction to methods and tools available for common fisheries analyses in R, including length-frequency histograms, length-weight regression, growth curves, and proportional size distribution (PSD). Methods are demonstrated using base R functionality in addition to functions available through the `FSA` package for R (<a href="https://github.com/droglenc/FSA">Ogle et al. 2020</a>). 

<b>Introduction to spatial data in R</b>: a (really basic) introduction to working with and plotting data commonly used in geographic information systems (GIS).

<h2 id = "multi"> **References** </h2>
Ogle, D.H., P. Wheeler, and A. Dinno. 2020. FSA: Fisheries Stock Analysis. R package version 0.8.30. Website:  [https://derekogle.com/fishR](https://derekogle.com/fishR)
